lexUnit.name: cunning.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: skilled in achieving one's ends by deceit or evasion.

sentence.text: You thought you had to be cunning to get what you wanted , did n't you ?
You should be as devious and cunning about this as the book is itself .
Take a couple of instances from Agatha Christie , who was marvellously cunning with it .
You were full of fire oh , maybe you were cunning with it too !
As I became more withdrawn , so I became more secretive and more cunning in finding ways of being alone .

This almost utopian-sounding conclusion -- that niceness and forgivingness pay -- came as a surprise to many of the experts , who had tried to be too cunning by submitting subtly nasty strategies ; while even those who had submitted nice strategies had not dared anything so forgiving as Tit for Two Tats .
The young woman in question , a casual acquaintance of my family in Vienna , had inflamed me with cunning caresses .
He said that in fact the gulden was very healthy , that no cunning ploy against Polish business had been intended , and that everything would be well again within two months .
One cunning old horseman used to jade a horse simply by pretending to feel the horse 's fetlocks , but with the palm of his hand covered with the repellent substance .
A less cunning photographer might have felt the urge to place a single figure , perhaps close to the columns , to give life and scale .
` They grind the faces of the poor and leave us only this , " Boris continued morosely in a cunning bid for sympathy , picking up the vodka bottle .
But here Microsoft has been cunning .
He was fickle and false , clever and cunning , and was usually symbolised by the tricksy flame of a forest fire , a classical emblem of wanton destruction .
You 'll have to be cunning , devious , smart .
He had been cunning , arriving so early that she could not pretend to be rushing to work .
Certainly the scheme you 've worked out is very cunning .
` I 've told you ; he 's crazy but he 's very cunning .
A marriage begun without financial security looks hazardous to the poet , let alone where the man seems cunning and manipulative .
Antonio is very cunning and shrewd though for he has got many ships and so does n't have all his eggs in one basket .
But he was as cunning as he was cruel , and at the first whisper of coming trouble he had secretly conveyed his treasures aboard a ship which was manned by devoted adherents .
